description: From Middle English overthwart, overthwert, overtwert, overquert, overwhart, equivalent to over- +‎ thwart. Compare Dutch overdwaars (“across”), Danish overtvært (“across”).

adjectives.description: overthwart (comparative more overthwart, superlative most overthwart)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Having a transverse position; placed or situated across; hence, opposite.
examples: […]  we whisper, for fear our over-thwart Neighbours
Should hear us cry, Liberty, and betray us to the Government.

adverbs.description: overthwart (comparative more overthwart, superlative most overthwart)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) That which is overthwart; an adverse circumstance; opposition.
examples: A hart wel stayd, in ouerthwartes depe,
Hopeth amendes: in swete, doth feare the sowre.

entries.meaning: (archaic, UK dialect) From one side to the other of.
